intro: Myrsine ouazangouensis, commonly known as the Ouazangou myrsine, is a species of flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds.
